newsitem.title: USA: Kansas fed cattle sales very slow at $61.50 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas fed cattle sales very slow at $61.50 - USDA.

text.p: DODGE CITY, July 9 (Reuder) - Trade was very slow, with not enough slaughter steer or heifer sales confirmed for an adequate market test, USDA said.
Wk to date - 74,900 last week - 73,200 last year - 11,600

Slaughter steers - Few Select and Choice 2-3 1175-1200 lbs 61.00-61.50; load Select with end Choice 1150 lb cutter bulls 60.00. Slaughter heifers - Few Select and Choice 2-3 1000-1100 lbs 61.00, pen mixed steers and heifers 61.50.

Inquiry moderate, demand rather light. Sales confirmed on 200 slaughter steers and 500 slaughter heifers Wednesday. For the week to date 74,900 head confirmed including 19,200 head or about 26 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle. Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.
